stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on finishing the underground oil-rig area of Return to Yoshi’s Island, building and coding a new ‘Fizz Oil’ enemy, adjusting visuals, and mentioning that Course 4 (the zoo) is ready for beta once Zeina’s animations arrive.

development_findings.summary: Course 4 (the zoo) has been fully repaired off-stream and is being queued for beta testing once Zeina’s remaining animations are delivered.
development_findings.quote: I finished fixing up course four so it's ready for beta testing – we're gonna send it off to be tested soon.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is working on the underground oil-rig room; remaining tasks were an oil drill prop, environmental oil clouds, and one custom enemy before moving on to the 8-bit section.
development_findings.quote: We're gonna be working on this today – we're probably gonna finish this… there's one enemy we need to… we can move on to the 8-bit section.

development_findings.summary: Created new ‘Fizz Oil’ enemy inspired by NSMB’s Fizzlit: it slimes around, turns into a puddle when it sees Mario, makes nearby floor slippery, can be cleaned (killed) with soap, and drops two coins.
development_findings.quote: Basically, what this is gonna do – this is gonna slime around, and then when it sees Mario, it's gonna go whoop… turn into a puddle… hitting them with soap just kills them.

development_findings.summary: Implemented slipperiness by dynamically editing the triangle Mario is standing on, avoiding core engine changes for performance.
development_findings.quote: Since we don't want to touch engine code, we need to somehow externally do this… we edit the surface, once Mario leaves we reset it.

development_findings.summary: Particle‐based death effect for Fizz Oil uses dark smoke to suggest ‘cleaning’ the oil; Kaze likens the custom particle system to a ‘poverty Niagara’ engine.
development_findings.quote: The particle engine is so useful for this… it definitely looks like you're cleaning it up now.

development_findings.summary: Added hashed geo-layout tables, extending usable model IDs up to 0x60 and freeing space.
development_findings.quote: We have hashing tables now instead of normal geo layouts… we can actually have up to model ID 0x60, which is insane.

development_findings.summary: Identified performance issue in scale-table matrix and logged a todo to transpose it for better cache behaviour.
development_findings.quote: Transpose the scale table matrix – what it is right now is terrible for cache.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 (the editor) is open-source; community members are fixing render bugs, but Kaze wishes more contributors would help.
development_findings.quote: Fast64 is open source and people are working on fixing the program up, although I wish there were more people working on Fast64.

development_findings.summary: Star-select screens must depict Mario travelling to the level; random characters (e.g., Peter Griffin) would ‘break the concept’.
development_findings.quote: The idea with the star selects is that it shows Mario traveling to the level, so if we have something like that, it's not gonna make much sense.

context_findings.summary: Kaze intends to open-source his engine so the community can maintain and hack it after he leaves the scene.
context_findings.quote: I will definitely open-source this… I want people to be able to maintain this code base after I leave the scene.

context_findings.summary: Financial viability influences project choices; developing a brand-new N64 game isn’t feasible because he must provide for family.
context_findings.quote: I wish I could, but it's not financially viable… I have a family now that I need to provide for.

context_findings.summary: Uses patch distribution to mitigate Nintendo legal risk and cites another hacker who hired an IP lawyer to restore a video.
context_findings.quote: I get around legal stuff by just releasing a patch, yeah.

context_findings.summary: Expresses excitement and pride in technical breakthroughs (“hashed geos”) and in completing Fizz Oil but also fatigue at end of stream.

biobak.summary: Kaze anticipates Biobak criticising polygon counts and optimises meshes to avoid ‘getting cussed out’.
biobak.quote: There are some polygons I can remove here… before Biobak cusses me out.

zeina.summary: Zeina is creating new animations for Course 4’s zoo section; their completion is the last blocker before beta testing.
zeina.quote: All we're waiting now is for a few animations that Zeina's making and after that course four is once again functional.

key_stories.title: Building the Fizz Oil Enemy
key_stories.summary: Kaze conceives, models, and programs a new oil monster in one sitting. He iterates on behaviour, eye animation, slipperiness mechanics, death particles, and balance considerations.
key_stories.challenge: Needed an original enemy to fit the oil-rig theme and introduce slippery hazard without heavy damage.
key_stories.process: Modelled a low-poly blob, scripted patrol→puddle states, dynamically edited floor friction, tuned eye textures, added soap kill logic, and created a smoky ‘clean’ particle effect.
key_stories.outcome: Enemy works in-game, drops two coins when cleaned, and final area is effectively complete pending visual touch-ups.
key_stories.key_quote: They're not very dangerous enemies, but they're very cool – they're here for the vibes.
